description.narrative:
Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The Liberia Embassy received a request from the United Nations Population Fund to finance the National Population and Housing Census project in Liberia with 70 million SEK during the period December 2018 to December 2022.
The main purpose of the contribution is to support the implemention of the National Population and Housing Census in Liberia, thus contributing to improving people's quality of life by providing updated and reliable data to the government and relevant actors, including the social, demographic and economic dimension of Liberia's population. This includes the definition of poverty reduction strategies and the preparation of social and economic development programs on the basis of updated statistics and data.
The total budget of the National Population and Housing Census project is 19 million USD, of which the host country's own funding amounts to approximately 6.76 million USD.

Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Ambassaden i Liberia fick en förfrågan av FN's Befolkningsfond att financiera projektet "National Population and Housing Census" i Liberia med 70 miljoner SEK under perioden december 2018 till december 2022.
Huvudsyftet med stödet är att genomföra befolknings- och bostadsräkningen i Liberia för att således bidra till att förbättra människors livskvalitet genom att ge regeringen och relevanta aktörer uppdaterad och tillförlitlig data om bland annat den sociala, demografiska och ekonomiska dimensionen hos Liberias befolkning. Detta omfattar definitionen av strategier för fattigdomsbekämpning samt utarbetande av sociala och ekonomiska utvecklingsprogram på grundval av uppdaterad statistik och data.
Den totala budgeten för "National Population and Housing Census" projektet är 19 miljoner USD, varav värdlandets egna finansiering uppgår till cirka 6.76 miljoner USD.

Impact: Government effectiveness is increased through evidence-based policy making, development, economic and governance planning, monitoring and evaluation. Outcome: Validated accurate Census statistics that can be used with confidence for planning development outcomes. Development objective: Contribute to the improvement of quality of life of the people by providing the Government and other stakeholders with relevant, reliable, sufficient and timely social, demographic and economic data and information for development planning, policy formulation and service delivery as well as for monitoring and evaluation of development programmes and plans.
